snippet: Brasa Rodizio bills itself as a rodizio — an all-you-can-eat style of restaurant where meats are carved tableside — and a churrasqueira, a place serving meats and fish grilled over wood briquettes on an open flame.
abstract: Joanne Starkey reviews Brasa Rodizio restaurant in Mineola (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: Brasa Rodizio bills itself as a rodizio — an all-you-can-eat style of restaurant where meats are carved tableside — and a churrasqueira, a place serving meats and fish grilled over wood briquettes on an open flame.

headline.seo: A Review of Brasa Rodizio Restaurant, in Mineola
headline.main: All You Can Eat, and Then Some
headline.print_headline: All You Can Eat, And Then Some
